question.questionText: Why was the siren's sound designed to have this property?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: So that people notice the sound.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: To get cars out of the way.
Because to warn people to get out of the way.
It is so loud about 2 blocks away can hear it.
So the cars and people would know that a is burning or is stuck in a small place so the peoples and cars could get out of the way for the fire engine could get through.
